p: V-type ATPase (VATA), an up-regulated protein in RGE-treated D.Â melanogaster, is categorized as a rotary ATP synthase/ATPase complex [41]. ATP synthase is a key enzyme of mitochondrial energy conversion, and inhibition of ATP synthase may cause energy deprivation and increased reactive oxygen species production. A high reactive oxygen species content induces cellular necrosis and/or apoptosis [42], [43]. Because the oxidative phosphorylation pathway is induced (via both VATA and ND75 up-regulation) by RGE treatment, this may provide the energy for the antiaging process and life span extension.
